title: Jegar-sahadutha
html: JEGAR-SAHADUTHA(Jeʹgar-sa·ha·duʹtha) [Aramaic, meaning “Witness Heap”].The Aramaic (Syrian) expression that Laban used to designate the heap of stones on which he and Jacob ate a covenant meal. This stone heap called Jegar-sahadutha was to serve as “a witness” that neither of them would pass it to harm the other. Jacob called it by the Hebrew equivalent “Galeed.”—Ge 31:25, 46-53; see GALEED.
